The SiteFooter component uses `RichText` module and when I use a regular div it works. Curious how we should test components that uses modules from the `@HubSpot/cms-components` .
<@UAYBXDG4U> is there a way?

Hi guys,

I see that there is now a way to develop entire CMS themes only using React:
<https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-react/tree/main/examples/getting-started-project-theme>

Is this correct?

The documentation isn't updated to reflect this.
It would be good to have more info on this as it's very relevant for us.

Hello Arrigo!

We are in the process of rolling out what we have been calling "Unified Themes" which means the following

• React Modules and Partials can be part of a theme
• The theme will be built via projects (not viewable in the Design Manager)
• The dev server will work holistically against a theme
    ◦ You can work locally against templates, modules, pages etc regardless of React or HubL
This rollout and documentation will be happening in the coming weeks.

This does not mean however the entire Theme will be in React. However, we are making good progress with a new building block `react_partial` which will allow higher level React Component to contain Modules - both React and HubL. Also this will allow us to ship DND components.
<@U044BTK3EGP> you can but if I were you I'd wait for what Byron mentioned above as for just marketing websites React is more of a hassle than an advantage
